reviewText: First off, let me apologize because this isn't a proper review.  But I didn't see any other way to pose these questions.  The editorial review above states there are 8 films in this collection, including at least one featuring Boris Karloff.  But there are only SIX movies listed on the cover, and Karloff isn't in any of them.  This page needs to be revised to reflect an accurate list of what's in this set.For the record, my 3-star rating isn't just arbitrary.  I have seen two of the films listed here, and they were quite entertaining.  THE SMILING GHOST is a terrific haunted house comedy, and SH! THE OCTOPUS is a silly but breezy little mystery film with some mild horror elements.I'll be glad to remove or revise my review once I have more accurate information to let me decide whether or not to pick it up.  If anyone else has it already, please post a review or some comments here.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Great collection of nineteen thirties B melodramas with a flair for ingenuity and giving young actors and character greats a chance to go crazy. If you are not a fan of TCM  pass on it. I had a blast.
summary: The Butler Did it. Oh,wait he's dead.

reviewText: Warner Bros. dug the bottom of the barrel for these films.  Picture quality is okay but story content is rather dull.  ANN SHERIDAN, the main reason I bought this set lacks her OOMPH. The nurses uniforms in both films do litte to enhance her glamor image, nor does she have any saucy lines to deliver.
